intro: Elegia capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, blue-green leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Elegia capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
